title: Show 157 - Claire Hanna
itunes:title: Show 157 - Claire Hanna
itunes:subtitle: Once again, a major crisis has added implicationsâ€¦
description:
Once again, a major crisis has added implications for the people of Ireland. Against the backdrop not just of Brexit, but a resurrected Assembly in the north and coalition negotiations after an election in the Republic, how differently is the crisis being handled in different parts of the island? What are the implications of the changing political situations either side of the border and what are the political implications of the crisis? Claire Hanna is the recently elected SDLP MP for Belfast South and has served as an MLA and councillor. She gives her unique insight into all these issues and more, in this hugely informative and ultimately hopeful interview. Follow Claire on Twitter here: @ClaireHanna Follow Matt on Twitter: @mattforde For the latest UK Government advice on coronavirus go to: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus For the latest NI Executive advice on coronavirus go to: https://www.nidirect.gov.uk/articles/coronavirus-covid-19-overview-and-advice For the latest Irish Government advice on coronavirus go to: https://www.gov.ie/en/campaigns/c36c85-covid-19-coronavirus/ *** IMPORTANT TOUR UPDATE *** NEW REARRANGED DATES INCLUDE: 2 October - Corby Cube 4 October - Brighton Komedia 9 October - Chorley Little Theatre 18 October - Leeds Hyde Park Book Club 25 October - Newcastle Stand 3 November - Camberley Theatre 13 November - Alnwick Playhouse 15 November - York Crescent 19 November - Cardiff Sherman Theatre 29 November - Glasgow Stand 3 December - Southend Dixon Studio 6 December - Sheffield Leadmill

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.
